data.title: Deciphering a code
data.solution:
s = input()
pattern = input()

a = sorted(sorted(s), key=lambda x: x.lower())
answer = []
for i in pattern:
    answer.append(a[int(i) - 1])
print("".join(answer))
data.statement:
The aim is to decipher a code based on a pattern. You must sort the input in alphabetical order (if there are duplicate letters, capitals are ranked higher than lower case, e.g. "cabBc" sorts to "aBbcc") you must then display the deciphered code based on the pattern. The pattern describes the order in which the letters in the code are displayed.

For example, if we have the word "JAva" we first order it alphabetically:
AaJv
We then receive the pattern:
4132
We must first get the fourth letter: v, then the first: A, then third (J) then second  (a), leading us with:
vAJa
data.constraints:
The length of [[s]]  < 10
[[pattern]] contains all digits up to the length of [[s]]

Goal

The aim is to decipher a code based on a pattern. The pattern describes the order in which the letters in the code are displayed.

For example, if we have the word "JAva" we first order it alphabetically:
AaJv
We then receive the pattern:
4132
We must first get the fourth letter: v, then the first: A, then third (J) then second (a), leading us with:
vAJa
Input
Line 1: A string s that represents the code.
Line 2: A number pattern that represents the numbered pattern to decipher the code with.
Output
A string containing the deciphered code
Constraints
The length of s < 10
pattern contains all digits up to the length of s
Example
Input
oCed
1423
Output
Code
